title.narrative: Women Empowered For Leadership

description.narrative: WE4L uses a combination of advocacy, skills training, knowledge tools and coalition-building. The program works directly with potential women leaders, as well as with political parties, trade unions, civil society organization, the media and the creative sector. Hivos and our local partners provide strategic, media and communication expertise.

title.narrative: 4.b. MWI Number of CSOs assisted to develop tools and manuals on women participation

comment.narrative: This number refers to the partners we have been working with and the tools we developed with them namely, community development guideline political party nomination guidelines women's manifesto

title.narrative: 4.b. ZWE Number of CSOs assisted to develop tools and manuals on women participation
1a. Political parties have been lobbied about equal representation policies and women’s quota in their constitutions
1.a ZMB Number of political parties reached concerning policies and/or quota for women's participation

comment.narrative: As by March 2019, 8 political parties engaged in dialogue and lobbied for revision of party policy to adopt quotas.

8 political parties lobbied on Quotas and adopting women on party tickets for local government positions. A total of 60 National Executive committee members of 8 political parties in the country were engaged on quotas and adoption of women. The 2019 National dialogue also provided a platform for follow up to the agenda, and considered the motion of adopting more women in local government and political parties.

title.narrative: 1.a JOR Number of political parties reached concerning policies and/or quota for women's participation

comment.narrative: NA
JNCW
In collaboration with JCNW

title.narrative: 1.a LBN Number of political parties reached concerning policies and/or quota for women's participation

comment.narrative:
One of our partners LADE held a Townhall meeting of which 7 political parties attended among other groups. During the meeting results of a study showing the lack of female participation was discussed, and the importance of female participation.
Our partner NCLW has lobbied 3 political parties to conduct a participatory gender audit. 2 (the Free Patriotic Movement (FPM), the Progressive Socialist Party (PSP)), have agreed with negotiations of the 3rd party (the Lebanese Forces (LF)) still underway.
The number 8 is to account for parties that have been lobbied by both partners.
An additional 3 parties have been lobbied by LADE: kataeb party, Marada, and Li Hakki movement.
A consultant under the WE4L programme has been working with 2 political parties, one of which has completed the audit. The second one has given its word to complete the audit to be conducted with Hivos's partner (NCLW). The consultant also audited a non-governmental organization - LADE - which involved presenting their audit findings to their team with recommendations touching on the effectiveness of their work on gender, and they have responded positively.

title.narrative: 1.a ZWE Number of political parties reached concerning policies and/or quota for women's participation

comment.narrative: In March 2018 Hivos co-hosted a Gender Equality Conference with Parliament of Zimbabwe. During this conference, there was direct engagements with parties where they were invited to sign a Gender Parity Pledge for local and national government towards 2018 elections. We engaged with 18 political parties in this process. In 2019 5 political parties were reached

title.narrative: 1.a MWI Number of political parties reached concerning policies and/or quota for women's participation

comment.narrative: Apart from the 5 main political parties which WE4L had envisaged to work with, there has been a new party which the programme have had no choice but to engage with, namely UTM. UTM is a political party led by the vice President of Malawi after he left the ruling democratic people's party (DPP). A number of women aspirants whom the programme has been engaging with from inception have left the other 5 parties for one reason or the other and some aligned themselves to the UTM. Leaving them out at the eleventh hour would be a loss for WE4L, so partners are engaging with some of them.

The programme was initially working with the 5 main political parties who have representation in the National Parliament but have recently had to work with the newly formed political party (UTM) by the vice President of Malawi who left the ruling DPP. Some of the of women WE4L has been engaging with have joined the UTM and we see benefit in still capacitating these women despite their party affiliations

title.narrative: 4c. Regulations and policies which enable (aspiring) women leaders to fulfill board positions in CSOs, trade unions, syndicates and political parties
4.c. ZMB Number of CSOs, trade unions, syndicates and political parties that have been assisted to get more women on board positions

comment.narrative: More women are likely to be promoted in boards, private sectors and private public companies, compared to politics. the numbers increase in boards slightly faster than in politics at Mps level. Women can ascend slightly easier as Councilors.
The number embraces both political parties and public administration institutions.
Includes political parties and public admin institutions

comment.narrative: Higher learning institutions keen to incorporate gender and promote girls and women in leadership, so are boards and councils, with some political parties especially in opposition.

he appointment of the female minister of Comesa, the appointment of the female minister of Gender, the appointment of two female students in two student unions, and the appointment of atleast 10 female councillors by political parties.

title.narrative: 1. Significant increase in women elected officials and new appointees at sub-national political and administrational level, participating fully and effectively
1.2 ZMB Number of women in political positions at sub-national/ local level (elected/ appointed)

comment.narrative: 61 Elected and appointed as by March 2019. 2 as councilors and 1 as minister, and 58 in company boards (54), student union boards (8), and trade Unions under public administration.
Target exceeded following by -elections

title.narrative: 1.1 ZMB Introduction of quota system for sub-national politics (in numbers of quota introduced)

comment.narrative: 8 political parties lobbied for quota in their party constitutions, at least 4 revised their constitution and adopted quota system to allow more women to contest seats under their parties.
8 quotas were written into Political party constitutions are yet to be fully/legally enforced. 1 quota to promote female election within students unions was introduced at a Training institute.

title.narrative: 1.3 ZMB Existence of internal policies and practices in state institutions and councils at sub-national level that promote work - life balance (in numbers of policies adopted)

comment.narrative: As by March 2019, none. However, there is need to define what is meant by work life balance.
1. Employment and labor act 2. Gender policy 3. Sexual Harassment policy

title.narrative: 1.1 MWI Introduction of quota system for sub-national politics (in numbers of quota introduced)

comment.narrative: NA

This work is towards quota at political party level and also to advocate for the implementation of the national gender equality act (GEA) which has a 40/60 quota of either sex nominated or appointed into public service
6 Political Parties actioned internal Quota's in Party Constitutions, one newly formed party engaged with us from 2019

title.narrative: 1.1 ZWE Introduction of quota system for sub-national politics (in numbers of quota introduced)

comment.narrative: NA
Focus of programme has been to stimulate debate on the local government quota. Parties have committed but have yet to formalise quota's within their constituions .

comment.narrative: Women only won 14% of local government seats in 2018 Elections, however a number have been appointed into leadership roles: In Dec 2020 Government agreed to introduce a 30% Quota for LGE's

comment.narrative: Malawi's 2019 Tripartite elections were found by the Constitutional court to be rigged. However the subsequent 2020 re-elections only related to Presidential level

title.narrative: 5a. Strengthened capacity of civil society organizations to advance women’s rights and gender equality
5.a. ZMB Number of CSOs trained and assisted to develop their capacities to promote women’s rights/gender equality

comment.narrative: NGOCC, Zambia National Womens Lobby, Centre for Inter-party Dialogue, Young Women Christian Association, Restless Development, Young Women in Action, Women for Change, and the Women parliamentary wing of Zambia.

Partners on WE4L and W@W were trained and assisted to develop training / mentor-ship manuals for their target audiences as per outcome indicators for which they are contracted to deriver by Hivos. Also CSOs trained during Nov 2018 and July 2019 partners retreat and review. Including CSOs reached by the partner organisations working with aspirants at community level.
Stawisha, Linking & Learning Events

title.narrative: 5.a. JOR Number of CSOs trained and assisted to develop their capacities to promote women’s rights/gender equality

comment.narrative: sigi and 7iber

title.narrative: 5.a. LBN Number of CSOs trained and assisted to develop their capacities to promote women’s rights/gender equality

comment.narrative:
AFE: Representatives from 9 NGOs attended the high-level meeting in support of protective policies against sexual harassment in the workplace, during this meeting they were provided with a report on sexual harrassment in the workplace and HR guidelines that can be implemented within their workplace.
Kafa is in the process of drafting a civil status law to increase the rights and conditions of women in Lebanon, this is in cooperation with a committee of legal experts. A legal committee formed by judges and lawyers, this committee includes 4 political parties.
NCLW had these trainings to improve gender knowledge and expertise for all its staff. Trhough our partnership with Kafa (Enough Violence) they were able to draft a civil law personal status in Lebanon that help ensure women's rights in different aspects.

title.narrative: 5.a. MWI Number of CSOs trained and assisted to develop their capacities to promote women’s rights/gender equality

comment.narrative: We are taking it that the partners under WE4L have their capacities strengthened through their interactions with Hivos

title.narrative: 5.a. ZWE Number of CSOs trained and assisted to develop their capacities to promote women’s rights/gender equality

comment.narrative: Stawisha, Linking & Learning Events, Financial & M & E CD, communications & advocacy training etc

title.narrative: 3.a. MWI Number of articles and broadcasts that portray positive views of women leadership in the media

comment.narrative: the number of articles and broadcasts is cumulative from when the programme began. The increase has happened because of the radio programs through capital FM which involved:- • Produced and broadcasted 17 radio documentaries every Wednesday at 3.30PM and broadcasted 17 repeats every Sunday at 7:10PM • Broadcasted 238 PSA’s for the period • Posted 189 social media posts for the period based on Facebook and Twitter data

3b. Target populations have been addressed and triggered to think positively about women’s political participation and leadership

comment.narrative: This has been done through road shows, Online articles, News coverage and press statements.

election campaigns encouraging voting on women for public conducted using various platforms

comment.narrative: throough sigi media outreach and events.

title.narrative: 3.b. LBN Number of people addressed and triggered to think about women’s participation and leadership

comment.narrative:
Maharat: The stories produced by Maharat-news are reaching thousands of people. For example a videos on the right of mothers to open accounts for their children reached more than 42 K views, 2 articles on sexual harrassment and stereotype on women in sports reached 17K each. Lebanon Support: Round table on 2 briefing papers, attendance: 46 (including media, elections candidates, civil society actors); visits on briefing paper on women candidates: 620; visits on briefing paper on new actors: 596
Maharat: In the period between July-Dec: The political parties video reached 34.7K on facebook with 27.366 video views and 559 post engagement; the discrimination in sports video reached 20.4 K on facebook with 406 post engagement. The access to information reached 16.1 K on facebook. These are examples of teh reach of stories on facebook. And one post reached approximately 30k. This is the reach of one post on facebook page of maharat-news page for the articles highlighting gender equality issues and success stories of women actors for change.
73782 number of visits on WE4L Lebanon Support publications: - policy brief: "Lebanon’s 2018 Election: New measures and the resilience of the Status Quo" - briefing paper : "Politics, Progress, and Parliament in 2018: Can Lebanese Women Make Headway?" - briefing paper: "Lebanon’s 2018 Elections: An Opportunity for “New” Political Actors?" - case studies: "Breaking the political glass ceiling: Enhancing women's political participation in Lebanon" - policy brief: "Women’s Political Participation: Exclusion and Reproduction of Social Roles Case Studies from Lebanon" - infographic: "Barriers hindering women's full political participation in Lebanon - timelines: "Women, power, and politics: milestones from Lebanon"

title.narrative: 3.b. MWI Number of people addressed and triggered to think about women’s participation and leadership

comment.narrative: The number represents a combination of all partner efforts since 2016 and involves community meetings, engagements with religious, traditional and political leaders and general public. A weekly radio program on women's empowerment has reached 68, 557 in one quarter! In the period January-April Capital FM has reached close to 5 million including through • Produced and broadcasted 17 radio documentaries every Wednesday at 3.30PM and broadcasted 17 repeats every Sunday at 7:10PM • Broadcasted 238 PSA’s for the period • Posted 189 social media posts for the period based on Facebook and Twitter data

title.narrative: 3.2 LBN Proportion of target population that is positive towards women equal political participation (in %)

comment.narrative: This needs updating/refining because it relies on draft survey we conducted - results came in end of July. The 22% represents respondents for 50% of total no. of seats in parliament to be allocated towards woman. June 2018 statistic. This is the closest stat we have to answer this question. Another stat: 64% are in favour of some form of quota or allocation of seats.

comment.narrative:
Maharat: 26 participants from various political parties, 15 young female leaders and 19 press officers participated in a Thomson Foundation led trainings in October and November on political communication. And 19 young female leaders from different universities participated inn a political communication training conducted by Maharat and Thomson Foundation on 16 and 17 October.

title.narrative: 2a. Linkages between (aspiring) women leaders and (women’s) CSOs have been created, as well as linkages with media, the creative sector, and real-world and virtual networks
2.a ZMB Number of (aspiring) women leaders with whom CSOs from our network have established linkages

comment.narrative: The number is increasing as we approach election year 2021 for Zambia.
Target not reached as plans to scale up work pre 2020 election were disrupted by Covid: Many women did not have IT access/skills

title.narrative: 2.a JOR Number of (aspiring) women leaders with whom CSOs from our network have established linkages

comment.narrative: through sigi 50 women through CSOs reached through sigi.

title.narrative: 2.a LBN Number of (aspiring) women leaders with whom CSOs from our network have established linkages

comment.narrative:
Linkage between women candidates and media were established. Maharat supported 10 women candidates to use their right to complaint and access the public broadcast and followed their applications in the SCE, the ministry of information and Tele Liban. 7 out of 10 candidates conducted interviews (28,29,30 April and 1 and 2 May 2018). Also many women candidates were referred by Maharat to international and local media.
Linkages were made between around 25 women between gender focal points in different ministries along with civil society organizations, investigative journalists from different media outlets, the NCLW and legal experts.
Linkages were also made with media faculties in universities in Beirut and Bekaa. Meetings were held with BAU, LU, LIU and AUB to sensitize youths (future journalists) to participate in project's activities supporting women in leadership. Students participated indeed in the 11 October event.
45: Global Dreamweb conducted a leadership training for your aspiring women and girls.

title.narrative: 2.a MWI Number of (aspiring) women leaders with whom CSOs from our network have established linkages

comment.narrative: These women leaders are aspiring for the position of councillor at the sub national level and are contesting either on political party ticket or as independents in the 21 May 2019 elections

title.narrative: 2.a ZWE Number of (aspiring) women leaders with whom CSOs from our network have established linkages
1c. State institutions and councils have been informed, lobbied and trained on policies and practices that enable women's participation and leadership

comment.narrative: 560 from public institutions, political parties and trade unions.
Through engagement with labor movements, and the ministry of gender as well as selected councils, 350 have since been lobbied for revision and adoption of policies which favor women.

75 Sigi 1000 Gender barometer. 500 baseline study 500 via public events like 16 days of activism the logic behind counting servey sample is that engaging people in the research will have informed them about women leadership through the survey questions

title.narrative: 1.c LBN Number of individuals in state institutions and councils informed, lobbied, advised and/or trained on enabling policies and practices for women's leadership

comment.narrative: AFE = launched a report and HR guidelines on sexual harassment in the workplace, and how this prevents women from progressing and taking on leadership positions within government, political parties, and their organisations. 65 specialists and key decision-makers from 43 organizations committed to ensuring safe and equal workplaces.

title.narrative: 1.c MWI Number of individuals in state institutions and councils informed, lobbied, advised and/or trained on enabling policies and practices for women's leadership

comment.narrative: WE4L partners are working with local district councils and they sit on the district executive committees with other key civil society organisations. There is collaboration and partnership at this level which ensures timely delivery of objectives
There has been continued engagement with various actors on women's empowerment

title.narrative: 1.c ZWE Number of individuals in state institutions and councils informed, lobbied, advised and/or trained on enabling policies and practices for women's leadership

comment.narrative: Target exceeeded through engagement with labor movements, and the ministry of gender as well as selected councils,

title.narrative: 4a. Staff of civic organizations informed, lobbied and trained on ensuring women’s equal participation in decision-making and leadership in their own organization through internal procedures
4.a. ZMB Number of individuals from civic organizations informed, lobbied assisted and/or trained to create enabling environment for women's leadership within their own circles

comment.narrative: CSO partners and front runners in women in leadership from political parties, trade unions, men parliamentary coccus, and student unions.

These have been informed , lobbied through quarterly partners workshops / retreats, linking and learning, online communications and sharing of project documents too, as well as project support visits both in finance and programming.

title.narrative: 4.a. JOR Number of individuals from civic organizations informed, lobbied assisted and/or trained to create enabling environment for women's leadership within their own circles

comment.narrative: through sigi
Partners staff and direct beneficiaries

title.narrative: 4.a. LBN Number of individuals from civic organizations informed, lobbied assisted and/or trained to create enabling environment for women's leadership within their own circles

comment.narrative:
Political parties: Future Movement, Free Patriotic Movement: 9
Plus 7 meetings with political parties: Kataeb, Lebanese Forces, Tayyar, Socialists, Future, Amal, Hizbullah: Meetings were held with women committees inside all political parties in Lebanon to discuss the importance of having more women visible and active in the political parties. Discussions went around the internal efforts inside parties to empower women and possibilities of support especially in communication. Each party showed interest to nominate active women to participate in the political communication training.
Maharat engaged with political parties to sensitize them to have more women in leadership. A report highlighted how they work internally on women empowerment http://maharat-news.com/News/سمع/137929/اكاديمية-مراة-في-احزاب-لبنانية Also Maharat engaged with gender focal points and NCLW to assess the challenges they face in their ministries. http://maharat-news.com/News/سمع/137930/منسقو-ات-نوع-اجتماعي-في-وزارات-ادوار-وتحديات

title.narrative: 4.a. MWI Number of individuals from civic organizations informed, lobbied assisted and/or trained to create enabling environment for women's leadership within their own circles

comment.narrative: hese have been informed , lobbied through quarterly partners workshops / retreats, linking and learning, online communications and sharing of project documents too, as

title.narrative: 4.a. ZWE Number of individuals from civic organizations informed, lobbied assisted and/or trained to create enabling environment for women's leadership within their own circles

comment.narrative: Gender Commission involvement was instrumental in exceeding this target

title.narrative: 2. Women’s CSOs and established and aspiring women leaders collaborate and impact political and societal development and opinions
2.1 ZMB Number of women’s CSOs with linkages to networks for political and social support of women leadership

comment.narrative: Engaged with women CSOs which reviewed and validated the gender audit of key institutions in country and came up with plans of action to challenge the obtaining decrease in number of women in leadership.

Through networks under WE4L NGOCC and Womens Lobby, a total of 73 community based organisations and networks in different wards have been reached with information on networking for increased women leadership at sub national and national level.

title.narrative: 2.3 ZMB Number of women leaders with improved communication skills

comment.narrative: Female aspiring Councillors and MPs who were mentored under WE4L able to express themselves with content in public, and assertive to seek answers from those above them.
These are trained via dialogue i.e support to the Women Parliamentary caucus with position papers, gender strategy, mentor-ship sessions with female leaders.

title.narrative: 2.4 JOR Capacity assessment forecasts and scores of CSOs in setting up systems to promote women’s equal participation (rate from 1 to 10 / 10 being highest score)

comment.narrative: NA. Can the MOF share capacity assessment tool to implement with Hivos Jordan partners to report in this indicator.

title.narrative: 2.4 ZMB Capacity assessment forecasts and scores of CSOs in setting up systems to promote women’s equal participation (rate from 1 to 10 / 10 being highest score)

comment.narrative: Of the 8 prominent women CSO, at least 4 are showing improvement in promoting womens leadership.
At least 8 (7 partners on WE4L and Hivos Zambia WE4L) have put in place strategic plans and forecast on how to promote Womens Equal Participation.

title.narrative: 2.2 ZMB Number of women leaders participating in autonomous virtual and/or real-world spaces

comment.narrative: Reached to women leaders via community meetings, workshops, policy briefs and political party meetings.

The women not only participate via seminars and workshops, but follow and take part on whats app pages, face book as well as twitter under Restless Development, Zambia National Womens Lobby and NGOCC.

The women not only participate via seminars and workshops, but follow and take part on whats app pages, face book as well as twitter under Restless Development, Zambia National Womens Lobby and NGOCC.

title.narrative: 2.3 JOR Number of women leaders with improved communication skills

comment.narrative: though 7iber and sigi trainings .
Sigi, Ahel, 7iber, anhre, Drabzeen, and hivos direct implementation
Sigi, Ahel, 7iber, anhre, Drabzeen, and hivos direct implementation

title.narrative: 2.2 JOR Number of women leaders participating in autonomous virtual and/or real-world spaces

comment.narrative: through 7iber and sigi during 2016 and 2017
Target not met due to Covid restrictions

title.narrative: 2.1 JOR Number of women’s CSOs with linkages to networks for political and social support of women leadership

comment.narrative: through sigi
through partners.

title.narrative: 2.1 LBN Number of women’s CSOs with linkages to networks for political and social support of women leadership

comment.narrative: Hivos works directly with CSOs, of which we have regular coordination meetings, and of which within their scope of work they are creating and building upon their linkages to networks for political and social support of women leadership.

title.narrative: 2.3 LBN Number of women leaders with improved communication skills

comment.narrative:
Maharat: 26 participants from various political parties, 15 young female leaders and 19 press officers participated in a Thomson Foundation led trainings in October and November on political communication. And 19 young female leaders from different universities participated inn a political communication training conducted by Maharat and Thomson Foundation on 16 and 17 October.
(45)GDW: the aspiring women leaders who participated in this program had visibly improved communication skills. Through partnership with Maharat 8 aspiring leaders participated in debates on news platforms and 100 women partcipated in relevant events organised by KYP

title.narrative: 2.2 LBN Number of women leaders participating in autonomous virtual and/or real-world spaces

comment.narrative:
Maharat: An event on women and IT aimed aimed at highlighting the importance of technology and ICT to increase women's visibility. 3 success stories of women were highlighted and the event hosted university students to inspire them and sensitize them on the role of ICT in advancing women's rights causes and success stories. The event was attended by around 50 persons.
Another event was held on the international access to information day on 27 September gathering journalists, NCLW, gender focal points, legal experts, researchers and CSOs actors. The event gathered around 20 actors.
Women and civil society candidates, as well as campaign managers during the parliamentary elections, participated in a closed discussion with LCPS, on women's and civil society's participation in the elections. So far, one discussion has been held with six attendees from the district of Tripoli.
(45)GDW: held one retreat for young aspiring women leaders (70)Hivos held a 1/2 day discussions with aspiring women leaders on the perceptions of the lebanese when it comes to womens leadership. (45)Hivos launched the women's achievment timeline with attended by many aspiring women leaders.

title.narrative: 2.3 MWI Number of women leaders with improved communication skills

comment.narrative: Mostly in reference to female aspirants who have been supported in readiness with the 21 May, 2019 elections

title.narrative: 2.3 ZWE Number of women leaders with improved communication skills

comment.narrative: Target exceeded as we recognised the impact of this work and scaled up efforts

title.narrative: 2.2 MWI Number of women leaders participating in autonomous virtual and/or real-world spaces

comment.narrative: The number has gone up significantly because of the engagement of a radio station which has national coverage and we are running a progam called women in politics. This project also has a twitter and facebook promoting women aspirants

title.narrative: 2.4 LBN Capacity assessment forecasts and scores of CSOs in setting up systems to promote women’s equal participation (rate from 1 to 10 / 10 being highest score)
2.4 MWI Capacity assessment forecasts and scores of CSOs in setting up systems to promote women’s equal participation (rate from 1 to 10 / 10 being highest score)
2.2 ZWE Number of women leaders participating in autonomous virtual and/or real-world spaces

comment.narrative: Target exceeded due to increased online engagement due to Covid

title.narrative: 2.1 MWI Number of women’s CSOs with linkages to networks for political and social support of women leadership

comment.narrative: Target exceeded due to collaborative efforts towards a malawi women's manifesto. The manifesto has since been developed and launched

title.narrative: 2.4 ZWE Capacity assessment forecasts and scores of CSOs in setting up systems to promote women’s equal participation (rate from 1 to 10 / 10 being highest score)
2.1 ZWE Number of women’s CSOs with linkages to networks for political and social support of women leadership

comment.narrative: Includes from Women's Manifesto work and via WcoZ structures

title.narrative: 1b. Decision-makers of political parties and state institutions have been targeted & advised on strengthening of women’s participation
1.b ZMB Number of political parties’ representatives and state officials targeted/reached/ advised on strengthening of women’s participation

comment.narrative: Q 1 of 2019 saw female councilors, party secretaries, womens wing of parliament being engaged in advocating for more women to be in leadership, as well as trade unions and heads of public offices. This saw 15 Manifestos from 15 political parties reviewed by the centre for inter-party dialogue.

At least 200 political party representatives of the main 8 key parties in Zambia have been reached through WE4L partners Zambia National Womens Lobby and the Centre for Inter party Dialogue. With members of the Women parliamentary Caucus and members of the National Dialogue forum held in 2019 in Lusaka.

title.narrative: 1.b JOR Number of political parties’ representatives and state officials targeted/reached/ advised on strengthening of women’s participation

comment.narrative: trough sigi advocacy effort under election monitoring from gender perspective.
ANHRE: 9 initiatives x 2 = 18 plus media campaigns estimate # 30 Drabzeen = 660 Sigi: 6x50 via conferences. Ahel: 30 Hivos direct interventions 100

title.narrative: 1.b LBN Number of political parties’ representatives and state officials targeted/reached/ advised on strengthening of women’s participation

comment.narrative:
20=LADE workshop in May with political party representatives 80=Maharat (MPs and political parties stated they support women's political participation in interviews conducted by Maharat-news to assess their positions on different topics including policies related to preventing discrimination against women.) 7 parties= Maharat held meetings were held with women committees inside all political parties in Lebann to discuss the importance of having more women visible and active in the political parties. Discussions went around the internal efforts inside parties to empower women and possibilities of support especially in communication.
LADE has been doing this work with the following number of representatives per party: Li Hakki political movement (22 representitives), Kataeb Political party (14 representitives), and Marada Movement (19 representitves) And a consultant under the Participatory Gender Audits lobbied the Future movement (4 representitives).

title.narrative: 1.b MWI Number of political parties’ representatives and state officials targeted/reached/ advised on strengthening of women’s participation

comment.narrative: Much of the work done has now been to follow up on the commitments made by political party representatives in the previous year

Partners intensified political party engagement prior to 2019 Tripartite elections incl with party secretary generals, governors, women's wings directors are among those being targeted to ensure women's participation is strengthened.

title.narrative: 1.b ZWE Number of political parties’ representatives and state officials targeted/reached/ advised on strengthening of women’s participation

comment.narrative: Target exceeded: Work intensified towards programme end with the intensive campaign around the quota system that targetted all levels of parties

title.narrative: 4. Civic organizations demonstrate a significant change in their policies and practices on full and equal participation of women in leadership positions

4.1 ZMB Existence of internal organizational procedures to provide for equal participation of men and women in organizational leadership structures (in numbers of civic organizations with procedures adopted)

comment.narrative: Among prominent women CSOs working with women in Zambia.

title.narrative: 4.3 JOR Percentage of women in board positions in selected social organizations and political parties

comment.narrative: NA
NA

title.narrative: 4.2 JOR Number of tools and manuals developed by CSOs on women participation

comment.narrative: Sigi how to monitoring election from gender perspective.

title.narrative: 4.2 ZMB Number of tools and manuals developed by CSOs on women participation

comment.narrative: WE4L partners finalized and developed manuals including W@W
Each CSO under WE4L has now developed, adopted a manual for mentor-ship or activity guidance.

title.narrative: 4.2 MWI Number of tools and manuals developed by CSOs on women participation

comment.narrative: The tools include those partners will assist in translating and publishing not necessarily only developing them
Community handbook CSO assessment tool Guidelines on party nominations Women's Manifesto

title.narrative: 4.2 LBN Number of tools and manuals developed by CSOs on women participation

comment.narrative: Maharat: One training toolkit produced in support of Thomson Foundation on political communication to be used in training women leaders after th eelections. One video including tips for journalists on how to interview women (http://maharat-news.com/News/سمع/137854/ارشادات-صحافيين-عند-اجراء-مقابلات-مع-مرشحات) One video including the importance of using women as sources and giving them more space in media (http://maharat-news.com/News/سمع/137857/نساء-خبيرات-مرشحات-في-اعلام) One animation on media monitoring study briefings (http://www.maharatfoundation.org/womenelectionstudy) Study assessing communication of women during elections

title.narrative: 4.3 LBN Percentage of women in board positions in selected social organizations and political parties

comment.narrative:
as of July 2018, from updated data gathered by Hivos: *Selected Unions: Beirut Bar Association: 17% Order of Physicians: 17.13% Teacher's Syndicate: 0%
*Political Parties: (8 Targeted): 17.04
Average % of members who are female (over 7 parties - SSNP did not provide data): 39%.
*Judiciary: Court of Cassation: 10% Supreme Judicial Council: 0% Court of Appeal: 29.8% Court of Audit: 50%
Number of female judges: 41%

title.narrative: 4.3 ZMB Percentage of women in board positions in selected social organizations and political parties

comment.narrative: 16% is the current at sub national level, and about 30% at ministerial level with public administration being in the range of 18% for top leadership positions (Refer to gender audit report of 2018 under WE4L Zambia National Womens Lobby).

title.narrative: 4.3 ZWE Percentage of women in board positions in selected social organizations and political parties
2b. Events, platforms, debates on women leadership, in which women leaders participate and are visible
2.b ZMB Number of (aspiring) women leaders who participated in relevant events, platforms, dialogues/debates on women leadership

comment.narrative: This number comprises of Female Mps, Councilors, and female leaders in trade unions and student unions.
They participated in mentor-ship sessions, seminars, and social media groups from political aspirants to students in public administration too.
They participated in mentor-ship sessions, seminars, and social media groups from political aspirants to students in public administration too.

title.narrative: 2.b MWI Number of (aspiring) women leaders who participated in relevant events, platforms, dialogues/debates on women leadership

comment.narrative: 78 were interviewed under the radio program and 422 attended different platforms/debates on women leaders including at the launch of the women's manifesto went took place in Lilongwe on 28 March 2019.165 more have been trained since

title.narrative: 2.b LBN Number of (aspiring) women leaders who participated in relevant events, platforms, dialogues/debates on women leadership

comment.narrative:
Maharat: Around 60 women candidates in latest parliamentary elections; 12 women youth leaders debate on the role of women in leadership; Around 15 women leaders reached out by Maharat as resources for the Maharat-news content related to women's rights
Maharat: An event on women and IT aimed aimed at highlighting the importance of technology and ICT to increase women's visibility. 3 success stories of women were highlighted and the event hosted university students to inspire them and sensitize them on the role of ICT in advancing women's rights causes and success stories. The event was attended by around 50 persons. Another event was held on teh international access to information day on 27 September gathering journalists, NCLW, gender focal points, legal experts, researchers and CSOs actors. The event gathered around 20 actors.
Women and civil society candidates, as well as campaign managers during the parliamentary elections, participated in a closed discussion with LCPS, on women's and civil society's participation in the elections. So far, one discussion has been held with six attendees from the district of Tripoli.
45 Global Dream Web: held one retreat for young aspiring women leaders (70): Hivos held a 1/2 day discussions with aspiring women leaders on the perceptions of the Lebanese when it comes to women's leadership. (45):Hivos launched the women's achievement timeline with attended by many aspiring women leaders.

title.narrative: 2.b JOR Number of (aspiring) women leaders who participated in relevant events, platforms, dialogues/debates on women leadership

comment.narrative: linked to the previous indicator

title.narrative: 2.b ZWE Number of (aspiring) women leaders who participated in relevant events, platforms, dialogues/debates on women leadership
